SourcedStatement: On Tuesday, the U.S. Department of Education (Department) announced over $11 million in grants to support the recruitment and retention of bilingual and multilingual educators and provide high quality programming to Native students in an effort to strengthen and revitalize Native American languages.
Name: U.S. Department of Education
Justification: This announcement comes as Secretary Cardona is embarking on his 2024 Back to School Bus Tour with stops in Wisconsin, Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, and Pennsylvania.

SourcedStatement: The Department also announced $3.7 million in grant funding for the Native American Language (NAL@ED) projects.
Name: U.S. Department of Education
Justification: A major emphasis of this program is to fund partial and full immersion programs, in addition to developing new or expanding existing language programs.

SourcedStatement: “Being multilingual is a superpower—a powerful asset that can connect students to their identity and culture, and gives those who speak more than one language cognitive, social, and economic benefits,” said U.S. Secretary of Education Miguel Cardona.
Name: Miguel Cardona
Title: U.S. Secretary of Education
Justification: The investments we’re announcing today advance our goal of providing every student in America with a pathway to multilingualism by supporting the recruitment, preparation, and retention of amazing bilingual and multilingual educators—some of the best teachers in our nation, period.

SourcedStatement: The NPD program provides grants to eligible institutions of higher education and public or private entities, in consortia with states or local educational agencies, to implement professional development activities that will improve language instruction for English learners.
Name: null
Justification: The program currently serves 94 entities throughout the nation.

SourcedStatement: The Department projects that these grantees will serve approximately 3,700 participants across nine states in four languages: Navajo, Sm'álgyax, Spanish, and Ute.
Name: null
Justification: This 2024 cohort represents the first set of grantees under a new absolute priority to increase the number of bilingual or multilingual teachers through a Grow-Your-Own (GYO) pre-service program that recruits teacher candidates who are bilingual or multilingual.
